    • testSolveLuDoesntSpoilTheVector

      @Test @DisplayName("solveLu(double[]) does not spoil the passed vector") void testSolveLuDoesntSpoilTheVector()

    • testSolveLuReturnsCorrectSolution

    • testSolveAccuratelyIsAccurate

      @Test @DisplayName("solveLuAccurately(double[]) returns a much more accurate solution than solveLu()") void testSolveAccuratelyIsAccurate()
      Generates a series of random matrices (data samples), solves the corresponding systems of linear equations, and estimates the minimum and average ratio of accuracy improvement achieved by the DoubleMatrix.solveAccurately(double[]) compared with the DoubleMatrix.solve(double[]). Asserts that the minimum improvement ratio is greater that EXPECTED_MIN_IMPROVEMENT and the average improvement ratio is greater than EXPECTED_AVR_IMPROVEMENT
      See Also:
      • EXPECTED_MIN_IMPROVEMENT

    • testRepeatedSolveLuReturnsCorrectSolution

      @Test @DisplayName("another call to solveLu(double[]) with another vector also returns a correct solution") void testRepeatedSolveLuReturnsCorrectSolution()

    • testSolveLuWithWrongVectorLengthThrowsException

      @Test @DisplayName("solveLu(double[]) with wrong vector length throws IllegalArgumentException containing \'must have the same size\'") void testSolveLuWithWrongVectorLengthThrowsException()

    • testSolveLuWithInconsistentDataThrowsException

      @Test @DisplayName("solveLu(double[]) with inconsistent data throws IllegalArgumentException containing \'matrix is unsolvable\'") void testSolveLuWithInconsistentDataThrowsException()

    • testSolveLuWithUnderdeterminedDataThrowsException
